content: dragon tail neckerchief materials needed  fingering yarn  g hook  yarn needle for weaving in ends  smaller needle for sewing on buttons  thread or small amount of lace weight yarn  buttons if you follow my patterns you know that i am a fan of the no turning chain double_crochet video tutorial available on youtube therefore this pattern is not written with any notation of a turning chain if you do not know how to do the no turning chain double_crochet or simply prefer not to do it you may replace the first double_crochet in each row with a ch3 this pattern also begins with a magic_ring if you don t know how to do magic_ring or prefer not to you may begin with a ch1 worked in back and forth row turn at the end of each row begin with magic_ring row 1 3dc in magic_ring row 2 3dc in first st 1dc in next st row 3 2dc in first st 1dc in next st continue alternating to end of row row 4 3dc in first st 1dc each in next 3 sts row 5 repeat row 3 row 6 3dc in first st 1dc each in next 5 sts repeat row 5 and 6 to desired size every even row and 2 more double_crochet to end of row i worked to 33 sts after the 3dc 18 points including 3dc from row 1 with yarn needle weave in ends button placement on the inside side opposite points of your last row loosely sew on your buttons with thread or lace weight yarn leave tails to weave in later yes i know weaving ends sucks but it will look lots better and your buttons will be more secure as well either strategically place two or three just to be used as closures or add more for decoration be sure that the button is small enough to pass through the space between stitches but big enough that the neckerchief will remain closed i used 5/8 buttons but you may find you need buttons of a different size
